alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:06PM CDT until June 02 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Borden County in western Texas... Northwestern Glasscock County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Southeastern Martin County in western Texas... Northeastern Midland County in western Texas... Northwestern Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 706 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and Flooding reported in Big Spring. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Big Spring, Snyder, Greenwood, Stanton, Coahoma, J B Thomas Reservoir, Sand Springs, Fluvanna, Lomax, Vincent, Knapp, Cuthbert, Ira, Randalls Corner, Winston Field, Dunn, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Elbow and Hermleigh. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Scurry
